string.last_approved_text:
This is your army, consisting of your retinues and units. Use this area to review your forces in battle and keep an eye out for notifications.

[[img:help_mode_battle_ability_timer]][[/img]] This is the [[b]]ability timer[[/b]] for this character's special abilities.

[[img:help_mode_battle_retinue]][[/img]] This icon indicates which units belong to this character's [[b]]retinue[[/b]], or, when selecting a non-character, indicates the character that this unit [[b]]belongs to[[/b]].

[[i]]Left-click to select a unit. Ctrl+left-click will allow you to select multiple units. Double left-click will zoom to the unit.

Press Ctrl+# to create a control group incorporating all your selected units.[[/i]]

random_localisation_strings.string:
This is your army, consisting of your retinues and units. Use this area to review your forces in battle and keep an eye out for notifications.

[[img:help_mode_battle_ability_timer]][[/img]] This is the [[b]]ability timer[[/b]] for this character's special abilities.

[[img:help_mode_battle_retinue]][[/img]] This icon indicates which units belong to this character's [[b]]retinue[[/b]], or, when selecting a non-character, indicates the character that this unit [[b]]belongs to[[/b]].

[[i]]Left-click to select a unit. Ctrl+left-click will allow you to select multiple units. Double left-click will zoom to the unit.

Press Ctrl+# to create a control group incorporating all your selected units.[[/i]]

string.last_approved_text:
Victory in a settlement battle is determined by [[b]]victory points[[/b]].

[[img:help_mode_battle_capture_points]][[/img]] Once the attacker is in control of the victory point by [[b]]capturing[[/b]] it with his own units, this number will start to [[b]]tick down[[/b]]. As long as the defender is in control of the victory point, this number will remain [[b]]static[[/b]].

Once this number [[b]]reaches 0[[/b]], the attacker has won the battle and captured the city.

random_localisation_strings.string:
Victory in a settlement battle is determined by [[b]]victory points[[/b]].

[[img:help_mode_battle_capture_points]][[/img]] Once the attacker is in control of the victory point by [[b]]capturing[[/b]] it with his own units, this number will start to [[b]]tick down[[/b]]. As long as the defender is in control of the victory point, this number will remain [[b]]static[[/b]].

Once this number [[b]]reaches 0[[/b]], the attacker has won the battle and captured the city.

string.last_approved_text:
This value shows the relative [[b]]destruction level[[/b]] of this settlement.

[[img:help_mode_battle_destruction_level]][[/img]] [[b]]Destruction level[[/b]] increases when buildings are [[b]]set on fire[[/b]] and areas of the settlement are being [[b]]destroyed[[/b]].

High levels of destruction will cause a [[b]]morale penalty[[/b]] for the defender.

random_localisation_strings.string:
This value shows the relative [[b]]destruction level[[/b]] of this settlement.

[[img:help_mode_battle_destruction_level]][[/img]] [[b]]Destruction level[[/b]] increases when buildings are [[b]]set on fire[[/b]] and areas of the settlement are being [[b]]destroyed[[/b]].

High levels of destruction will cause a [[b]]morale penalty[[/b]] for the defender.

string.last_approved_text:
This button allows you to initiate [[b]]duels[[/b]] with characters in an enemy alliance. Winning duels will have a significant impact on the morale of forces and can be a deciding factor in battle.

Pressing this button will show you a list of enemies you can [[b]]challenge[[/b]]. For a duel to occur, a challenge must be [[b]]accepted[[/b]], and in some cases, the enemy might [[b]]reject[[/b]] the challenge.

For each character you can challenge, the possible [[b]]outcome[[/b]] of the duel will be highlighted. Some duels are about life or death and will only conclude when one of the combatants falls, while others are merely concerned with demonstrating one's battle prowess, or about the honourable contest between duellists.

By default, other soldiers will respect a duel and will [[b]]not interfere[[/b]]. You can order units to attack the enemy duellist, but this will be seen as a [[b]]dishonourable[[/b]] act and will have a negative morale effect on your forces. However, it can be the only way to save your hero's life.

You can also [[b]]run away[[/b]] from an ongoing duel – an equally dishonourable act.

Buffing your hero with other characters while a duel is ongoing is [[b]]not dishonourable[[/b]], however, and can be a strong strategy for improving your duellist.

random_localisation_strings.string:
This button allows you to initiate [[b]]duels[[/b]] with characters in an enemy alliance. Winning duels will have a significant impact on the morale of forces and can be a deciding factor in battle.

Pressing this button will show you a list of enemies you can [[b]]challenge[[/b]]. For a duel to occur, a challenge must be [[b]]accepted[[/b]], and in some cases, the enemy might [[b]]reject[[/b]] the challenge.

For each character you can challenge, the possible [[b]]outcome[[/b]] of the duel will be highlighted. Some duels are about life or death and will only conclude when one of the combatants falls, while others are merely concerned with demonstrating one's battle prowess, or about the honourable contest between duellists.

By default, other soldiers will respect a duel and will [[b]]not interfere[[/b]]. You can order units to attack the enemy duellist, but this will be seen as a [[b]]dishonourable[[/b]] act and will have a negative morale effect on your forces. However, it can be the only way to save your hero's life.

You can also [[b]]run away[[/b]] from an ongoing duel – an equally dishonourable act.

Buffing your hero with other characters while a duel is ongoing is [[b]]not dishonourable[[/b]], however, and can be a strong strategy for improving your duellist.

string.last_approved_text: This is the status panel for an [[b]]ongoing duel[[/b]], which allows you to keep track of its [[b]]progress[[/b]] and [[b]]strength comparison[[/b]]. If your hero is falling behind, it might be best to [[b]]intervene[[/b]] or [[b]]withdraw[[/b]] from the duel.\n\n(Romance mode only) Also consider [[b]]buffing[[/b]] your duellist by using the [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] of other heroes in your army.

random_localisation_strings.string: This is the status panel for an [[b]]ongoing duel[[/b]], which allows you to keep track of its [[b]]progress[[/b]] and [[b]]strength comparison[[/b]]. If your hero is falling behind, it might be best to [[b]]intervene[[/b]] or [[b]]withdraw[[/b]] from the duel.\n\n(Romance mode only) Also consider [[b]]buffing[[/b]] your duellist by using the [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] of other heroes in your army.

string.last_approved_text: This toggles the unit [[b]]info panel[[/b]]. Inspect this panel to review a unit's [[b]]statistics[[/b]] or [[b]]compare[[/b]] two units. Use the [[b]]tooltips[[/b]] on the info panel itself to understand each individual statistic.\n\nTo compare two units, [[b]]pin[[/b]] an info panel by selecting a unit, then mousing over a different one.

random_localisation_strings.string: This toggles the unit [[b]]info panel[[/b]]. Inspect this panel to review a unit's [[b]]statistics[[/b]] or [[b]]compare[[/b]] two units. Use the [[b]]tooltips[[/b]] on the info panel itself to understand each individual statistic.\n\nTo compare two units, [[b]]pin[[/b]] an info panel by selecting a unit, then mousing over a different one.

string.last_approved_text: This is the battlefield [[b]]tactical map[[/b]]. Use it to maintain an overview of bigger battles and to plan manoeuvres on a larger scale.

random_localisation_strings.string: This is the battlefield [[b]]tactical map[[/b]]. Use it to maintain an overview of bigger battles and to plan manoeuvres on a larger scale.

string.last_approved_text: You can alter the [[b]]speed of time[[/b]] in battle with these controls.

random_localisation_strings.string: You can alter the [[b]]speed of time[[/b]] in battle with these controls.

string.last_approved_text:
These are a unit's or character's special abilities.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_formations]][[/img]] Units are able to enter [[b]]formations[[/b]] that provide tactical abilities for certain situations. Investigate the [[b]]tooltip[[/b]] of a given formation to learn more about them.

[[img:help_mode_battle_special_ability]][[/img]] (Romance mode only) Characters can unlock powerful [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] that can change the course of battle. Depending on a character's background, they can cause [[b]]direct damage[[/b]], while other abilities are either [[b]]buffs[[/b]] for friendly troops, or [[b]]debuffs[[/b]] that can be used against the enemy.

[[img:help_mode_battle_skirmish]][[/img]] [[b]]Skirmish[[/b]] mode is available to most [[b]]ranged units[[/b]]. It means that the unit will try to [[b]]stay away from enemies[[/b]] and will retreat if they come too close.

random_localisation_strings.string:
These are a unit's or character's special abilities.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_formations]][[/img]] Units are able to enter [[b]]formations[[/b]] that provide tactical abilities for certain situations. Investigate the [[b]]tooltip[[/b]] of a given formation to learn more about them.

[[img:help_mode_battle_special_ability]][[/img]] (Romance mode only) Characters can unlock powerful [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] that can change the course of battle. Depending on a character's background, they can cause [[b]]direct damage[[/b]], while other abilities are either [[b]]buffs[[/b]] for friendly troops, or [[b]]debuffs[[/b]] that can be used against the enemy.

[[img:help_mode_battle_skirmish]][[/img]] [[b]]Skirmish[[/b]] mode is available to most [[b]]ranged units[[/b]]. It means that the unit will try to [[b]]stay away from enemies[[/b]] and will retreat if they come too close.

string.last_approved_text:
These are general [[b]]commands[[/b]] for the units in your army.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_run]][[/img]] [[b]]Run speed[[/b]] is turned on by default. It can be worth [[b]]turning it off[[/b]], however, if you need to prevent units becoming [[b]]fatigued[[/b]] while traversing the map.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_halt]][[/img]] [[b]]Halt[[/b]] instantly [[b]]cancels all orders[[/b]] and makes a unit [[b]]stop[[/b]] all movement and attacks. This can be used to stop artillery from continuing to fire into a settlement during a siege battle.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_toggle_group]][[/img]][[b]]Toggle group[[/b]] generates a [[b]]control group[[/b]] incorporating all [[b]]selected units[[/b]].

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_guard]][[/img]][[b]]Guard mode[[/b]] can be activated to order a unit to [[b]]stand its ground[[/b]]. This means it will [[b]]not pursue[[/b]] its enemy but rather [[b]]defend[[/b]] its current position.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_melee_mode]][[/img]] [[b]]Melee mode[[/b]] orders a unit to attack in melee instead of its ranged weapon. This can be useful to [[b]]conserve ammunition[[/b]], or if you want units to [[b]]charge[[/b]] into the enemy's ranks.

random_localisation_strings.string:

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_halt]][[/img]] [[b]]Halt[[/b]] instantly [[b]]cancels all orders[[/b]] and makes a unit [[b]]stop[[/b]] all movement and attacks. This can be used to stop artillery from continuing to fire into a settlement during a siege battle.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_toggle_group]][[/img]][[b]]Toggle group[[/b]] generates a [[b]]control group[[/b]] incorporating all [[b]]selected units[[/b]].

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_guard]][[/img]][[b]]Guard mode[[/b]] can be activated to order a unit to [[b]]stand its ground[[/b]]. This means it will [[b]]not pursue[[/b]] its enemy but rather [[b]]defend[[/b]] its current position.

[[img:help_mode_battle_context_melee_mode]][[/img]] [[b]]Melee mode[[/b]] orders a unit to attack in melee instead of its ranged weapon. This can be useful to [[b]]conserve ammunition[[/b]], or if you want units to [[b]]charge[[/b]] into the enemy's ranks.

• Save an army template
• Load an army template
• Delete an army
• Randomise the army (which will affect its size, composition and available funds – randomising will also delete any existing army).
• View the army's remaining funds

string.last_approved_text: This is the current composition of the army. It can be added to, removed from or ranked up as funds allow. Select a retinue, then double-click on a general in the Generals panel to add that general to the retinue.

string.last_approved_text: This menu allows you to customise the parameters of the battle itself – how big the units will be, the difficulty level, and how long the battle will last. You can also select whether or not to fight in Romance mode and turn on battle realism. You can also enable large armies, giving everyone in the battle access to more troops.\n\nCrucially, you can also begin the battle from here.

random_localisation_strings.string: This menu allows you to customise the parameters of the battle itself – how big the units will be, the difficulty level, and how long the battle will last. You can also select whether or not to fight in Romance mode and turn on battle realism. You can also enable large armies, giving everyone in the battle access to more troops.\n\nCrucially, you can also begin the battle from here.

string.last_approved_text: From here, you can increase your general’s rank. This will cost more but will make them more powerful, and allow a wider variety of units to be recruited.

random_localisation_strings.string: From here, you can increase your general’s rank. This will cost more but will make them more powerful, and allow a wider variety of units to be recruited.

string.last_approved_text: From here, you can customise the generals belonging to each retinue. Select a general after selecting a retinue and double-click to add them to that retinue..

string.last_approved_text: From here, you can alter the co-ordinates to more accurately select a map and see an aerial view of the map you have selected. You can also mark a map as a favourite and display all other favourite maps you have created.

string.last_approved_text: This menu allows you to choose and customise your map; you can select map presets, the settlement level and density, how many buildings there are and the level of escalation damage when under siege.

string.last_approved_text: This bar details the current balance of power between teams – the bar will shift left and right depending on which team is more powerful. The better the balance, the more enjoyable the battle is likely to be!
